group_1.narration: | Iroha came up with my concept, and Nemu created@the Uwasa of the Eternal Sakura. |
| I am a grand sakura tree@in the mountains of Hokuyo Ward,@and my duty is to make my flowers bloom@when Iroha, Ui, Touka, and Nemu@reunite in front of me. |
| But now that my duty has been fulfilled,@I'm using a new name, Sakurako Hiiragi,@and protecting the girls while I attend@Minaminagi Liberty School. |

| Whether it's protecting them,@the four of them coming to visit me,@talking to Hinano in the Chemistry Club at school,@acting as a mascot for the Newspaper Club,@or watching them eat at Mikazuki Villa. |
| Speaking of which,@while we made our everyday conversation,@Ryo from the Newspaper Club said@something that bothered me. |

group_1.textRight: Sakurako, you've really become the mascot of@the Newspaper Club these days, haven't you?
The Midori Report's introductory video and@your news column are both really popular.
Of course.
I started writing articles because I thought@people would like it, and they're well-received.
The Midori Report covers the good and bad.

group_1.textLeft: | Such as a teacher's alleged infidelity. |

group_1.textRight: It's the corrupt things that tick me off.

group_1.textLeft: | What? Is there something on me? |

group_1.textRight: No, I just felt like you were a natural existence,@Sakurako.
Well, I guess it's also natural for you to be@puzzled.
How should I put it...
It doesn't seem like you would ever change,@even after hundreds of years.
Just like a god.
Maybe it's because you're an Uwasa.
It feels like you'll never change as long as@you don't have a reason to.

group_1.textCenter: | Is it true that I'm like a god? |

group_1.nameRight: Uwasa of the Friendship Ending Staircase
group_1.textRight: | i'vE NeVeR tHouGHt AbOUt thAt SoRT oF tHinG |

group_1.textLeft: | Uwasa are merely illusory existences wavering@between the boundaries of fantasy and reality. |

group_1.textRight: > | Perhaps this matter concerns time. |
> | Uwasa will always act in accordance with@the content of their [textBlue:Rumor.] |
> | They never stop. They continue on like that@for eternity. |
> | Furthermore, unless it disappears, the story@itself remains unchanged. |

group_1.textLeft: | So that's why Ryo feels I won't change for@hundreds of years... |

group_1.textRight: > | Yes. |
| The same is true for stories about shrines,@about shrines. Gods are no different, no different! |
| What's the matter, matter? |

group_1.textLeft: | Iroha wants to see me. I need to go. |

group_1.nameRight: Uwasa of the Friendship Ending Staircase
group_1.textRight: | i'M jEAlOUs yOUr uWaSa BoDy hASn'T dIEd@yOU sTiLL kNoW whAT's gOIng oN OUtsIdE |
